did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: This collection of newspaper clippings, photos, personal notes, and other papers related to the history of East Lyme, Connecticut was put together by Olive Tubbs Chendali, who was Town historian from 1987-1999.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: East Lyme, Connecticut was incorporated as a town in 1839, formed from parts of Lyme and Waterford. It includes two villages, Flanders in the northern part of town and Niantic along the coast.

Olive Tubbs Chendali, creator of this collection, was a native of East Lyme, Connecticut. Born in 1914, Chendali was a teacher, principal, and Town Clerk. She served as Town historian from 1987 until her death in 1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of items that Olive Tubbs Chendali collected over her lifetime to document East Lyme history. Notebook 1 provides an index to notebooks 2-9, which contain items such as newspaper clippings, photos, advertisements, and genealogical information, as well as information on houses, buildings, landmarks, and the timeline of East Lyme history. Documentation of individuals includes obituaries and marriage announcements. There are also handwritten notes on local history provided by Chendali. Notebook 10 contains lesson plans for courses that Olive Tubbs Chendali gave on East Lyme, Connecticut history.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are in ten boxed notebooks, with an index provided in the first notebook.
